message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest carcinoid syndrome, which is most commonly associated with liver metastasis. Although carcinoid tumors can also metastasize to the lungs, brain, and pancreas, the liver is the most common site of metastasis. The fibrosis of the tricuspid valve is also a common finding in carcinoid syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and test results suggest a diagnosis of carcinoid syndrome, which is commonly associated with liver metastases. Carcinoid tumors are often located in the gastrointestinal tract and metastasize to the liver before spreading to other areas such as the lungs or brain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and findings suggest carcinoid syndrome, and for this syndrome, a metastatic disease to the liver is most commonly associated. Lung and brain are less commonly associated, while pancreatic metastasis is rare.
